points.text: Initial master setup required before using the system. These configurations define how the organization, users, and operational data are structured.

textParts.text: Configure Company: Defines the basic company details such as company name, address, contact information, logo, and legal identifiers. This is the
root configuration
for all other setups.

points.text: Setup Designation: Creates job titles or roles such as Manager, Engineer, or Accountant. Used for employee hierarchy, permissions, and reporting.
Setup Department: Defines organizational departments such as HR, Finance, and Operations. Helps in grouping employees and managing department-wise workflows.
Setup Leave Type: Configures different types of employee leave such as Casual Leave, Sick Leave, and Earned Leave. Used in leave management and attendance tracking.
Setup Shift: Defines working shifts with timings such as Morning Shift or Night Shift. Used for attendance, payroll, and work scheduling.
Setup Functions: Defines functional areas or responsibilities within the organization. Helps categorize work types, approvals, or operational roles.

textParts.text: Setup Personnel (Maximum 5): Creates and manages employee or user records including personal details, designation, department, and shift.
A maximum of 5 personnel can be added
during the bootstrap configuration and is used to control initial system access and licensing limits.
Setup Project (Maximum 2): Defines projects handled by the organization.
A maximum of 2 projects can be created
in the initial setup and is used for task tracking, assignments, and project-level reporting.

points.text: Setup HSN: Configures HSN (Harmonized System of Nomenclature) codes for goods and services. Required for GST compliance and tax calculations.
Setup Item: Creates items or products with pricing, tax details, and HSN mapping. Used in inventory management, billing, and purchase or sales processes.
Setup Party: Defines parties such as customers, vendors, or suppliers. Used in transactions, invoicing, and accounting workflows.
